inn1.comm: Off the mark with a leg bye. Drifting on to the pads and attempted flick doesn't make materialise and the ball rolls away to short fine leg
fuller, straighter, on the middle stump line, pushed back down the track
Again Pollock bowls the same length and the line. Akmal leans forward to defend with the full face of the bat

Gotcha! Pollock lands one just outside off and it nips back in. Akmal misreads the line, doesn't offer a shot, and is rapped in front of off stump. The height was the question, was it going over? But Bucknor, after a long typical delay, raised his finger and that's that. Hawk eye suggests that the ball would have gone over the stumps. Akmal was unlucky there.
this one lands outside off but doesn't jag back in, left alone
In the corridor outside off, again Pollock keeps doesn't bend it in and Younis shoulders arms
Now Ntini harasses the batsman with the nip-backer. This one bends back in with bit of bounce and rapped Imran Nazir on the thigh.
Nazir breaks free. Slightly short of length, coming in from outside off, and Nazir swivels to pull it and the ball shoots off between mid-on and the bowler
hits the deck short of length, outside off, stays there and Younis lets it go.
leans forward, close to the line of a fullish delivery outside off, drives to cover

First boundary arrives courtesy of a streaky edge. In the zone outsdie off and holding its line, Younis anticipates it would come in, and then adjusts by pushing at it with soft hands and the ball speeds past the second slip
In the Pollock channel - outside off, nudged to point
Wallop! Fullish, on the middle stump, you and me might have defended, not Nazir. He just leans forward, whips it across the line, over midwicket!
Now goes back to forces a back of length delivery, to deep point. Nice looking stroke.
In the channel outside off, left alone.
Boom! Slightly, very slightly, short of length and outside off stump, and that's enough licence for Imran Nazir to unfurl a spanking pull shot. Just rocks back and slaps it over midwicket
Meanwhile Younis continues to play himself in. Shuffles across ,covers the off stump and lets a delivery go through to the 'keeper

fuller, just outside off, Younis leans forward, opens the bat-face, nudges it to left of Gibbs at point who dives to make a stop. Younis thinks about a run, even communicates that thought to Imran who doesn't entertain that. Wise decision.
banged in short of length, on the off stump line, punched to cover
on a length, around off stump, steered to point
Again full in length, and this time outside off stump, left alone. Smith, at first slip, is impressed with the line and the length, yells out words of encouragement
leans forward, drives to mid-off.
Wham bham! What a shot. Short of length, outside off stump, Imran Nazir goes back and across and executes a super cut shot.
leans forward to a length-delivery on the off and middle and defends to the on side
Pollock switches to a fuller length. He has been spanked, pulled and cut whenever he bowled short. So quickly he is now operating a full length. defended away
Wallop! Spoke too soon. Slightly short of length and Imran Nazir pulls it behind square leg. Pollock continues to leak runs against a rampaging Nazir
fuller, around off stump, nudged to point
at the body, Younis stands up tall, tucks it away to fine leg
on the middle and leg, worked to square leg

Ntini nearly nails Nazir. Lands outside off, on a length, sort of holds its line, Nazir is squared up a touch and just pushes at it, and ends up scooping the ball in the air but falls well short of cover
Much fuller, around off stump, driven back
Bosh! Super shot! Banged in  short of length, Imran leans forward, then goes back and pulls it, rather nonchalantly, over deep midwicket. Imperious!
retains the strike with a nudge to square-leg
picks up a single with a nudge to the on side
just outside off stump, dabbed away to third man
defended to the off side.
Slap! Short of length, outside off - Pollock continues to bowl that length and Imran pulls it over mid-on!
on the off and middle, defended to the off side
ala Saeed Anwar! Fullish, on the middle stump line, Imran leans forward, flicks it across, behind square leg. Having said that, Anwar's pick-up flick shot  was a beautiful sight. This was effective.
on the middle and leg, bit of bounce, Imran just whips it away to long leg.
Younis tries to rotate the strike back to Imran with a nudge to the off side. But Imran sends him back.
short of length, bounces up above waist-high, around off stump, Younis goes back, sort of waves it to the on side and they run with the stroke
Smooth! From wide of the crease, overpitches it on the off stump, and Imran just whips it across the line - ala Azharuddin now!, through midwicket. Picked it from outside off.
short of length, outside off, Nazir cuts this fiercely but straight to point
Wow! Slap slog!  Just leans forward to a back-of-length delivery outside off and pulls it, off the front foot, through midwicket.
Short of length, outside off, Younis, as he has been doing ever since he came on, rotates the strike back to Imran with a dab to third man
Almost holes out ! Banged in short, at the body, Nazir goes for a pull, top-edges it and it goes over short fine leg fielder and drops in no man's land
outside off stump, run down to third man
Short of length, outside off stump, cut to third man

Thwack! SA continue to bleed at the hands of Imran. Fifty up in a blink! Short, outside off and Imran latches on to it with a fierce cut, Gibbs, at point, jumps up, the ball brushes his fingers enroute to the boundary. 32-ball fifty!
starts off with a wide down the leg side
on the hips, Younis allows the ball to come to him, flicks it past square leg. Prince makes a neat sliding stop near the boundary to pull the ball back in
again on the hips, dabbed away to square leg
Classy! Younis's second four. Overpitched outside off , Younis leans forward and caresses it straight down the track.
Wah! Wah! Cheeky but classy again! Short of length, outside off stump, Younis goes back and across, waits for the ball to come to him, opens the bat-face and late-cuts it past first slip.
on the hips, tucked to the on side.
short of a good length delivery delivery, coming in with the angle and Nazir defends it down towards cover

UP! UP! and forget it! short delivery on the stumps, Nel fails to gets the height he hopped for and Nazir pulls it high over the square leg fence - out of the ground she goes and the rampage continues
pulled away towards midwicket, failed to time it properly. Shy at the bowler's end stumps hits the target and the that allows the batsmen to cross over
line and length delivery outside the off stump, no shot offere
bit of edge and the ball rolls away towards gully, no room for a single there
short of a good length delivery on the stumps, defended straight back to the bowler
drives off the back-foot and the ball rolls away off the outer half of the bat to the point region
swing and miss! a rare sight - width offered outside the off stump and Nair gave it everything but failed to make contact

got'm! good length delivery, pitched outside the off stump and drifting in. Nazir just swings across the line but misses the target by miles and that's as plumb as it gets. End of an entertaining knock.
defended outside the off stump
another good length delivery, no real width and Yousuf defends it with a straight bat
clipped away to fine leg and Yousuf is off the mark with an easy single
left alone outside the off stump
half-volley outside the off stump, Nel is clearly struggling here. Yousuf lines it up nicely and drills away through cover point for his first boundary of the innings
excellent comeback delivery, this one shaped in a bit and Yousuf was beaten all ends up
and again. short in length but Nel hits the right line outside the off stump. Yousuf has a poke at it and the ball sails past the outside edge
fuller length delivery outside the off stump, defended on the front-foot
short of a good length delivery, another good effort delivery from Nel and Yousuf leaves it through to the keeper
driven away towards cover, placement was good but there was a bit of a misx-up going for the single
another gift! short and wide outside the off stump - had four written all over it and Khan slices it away to the backward point fence. Easy pickings
classy! short of a good length delivery, close to the off stump line - Khan leans back and allows the ball to slide off the face of the bat to the third man region
defended on the front-foot and the ball rolls away towards cover
good length and cutting in, Yousuf defends on the front-foot and the ball rolls away off the inside edge, very nearly rolled back on to the stumps
beaten. short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, nice shape in - Yousuf is sucked forward and beaten all ends up
steered away towards gully and they scamper through for a single
in the channel outside the off stump, Yousuf gets a good stride in and defends it down on the off side

wow! good length delivery outside the off stump, nothing wrong with the delivery. Yousuf walks into the drive and finds the gap between the cover fielders and the ball races away to the fence. The timing and placement was just superb
and the response is quickly and sharp. 150 kmh and close to the off stump line, Yousuf is caught on the wrong foot and the ball sails through to the cover
left alone outside the off stump
Nel drfits on to the pads and Yousuf nicely clips it away behind square on the leg side
fullish outside off, Younis goes back, square-drives it through backward point - classy shot and Pollock gets across from thirdman to make the stop
short and outside off, cut to point
leans forward to a fullish delivery, defends to off side
100 up for Pakistan. In the 16th over. Fullish, outside off, driven to left of mid-off and they pick up a easy single
drifts on to the pads, turned to the on side

Oho! whiplash flick over midwicket! Short of length, outside off stump, Younis shapes to pull but the ball doesn't bounce so much, nor is short enough and he adjusts admirably by a whipping it over the on side ring.
tip and run. Just tapped close on the off side and they rush across for a single
fullish, outside off stump, Yousuf drives but his bat-face shuts down early and the ball rolls away to mid on
almost cleaned up! yorker-length, slower one as well, outside off and Yousuf plays all over it and the ball brushes past off stump
bouncer and ducked under
driven to distraction! Low full toss and Younis just leans forward and drives it straight down the ground

And again. Almost. Overpitched on the off stump line and driven down the ground but Smith gives the chase and pulls it just before the ropes with a sliding stop. Did his feet touch the ropes in the process? Not sure and they don't go for third umpire and so it will be 3 as of now.
Outside off stump, on a length, Yousuf leans forward and pushes it out to cover region
Leans forward, drives towards mid off and will get a single
outside off stump, slightly short of length, dabbed away to thirdman
drifts on to the pads, Yousuf tries to work it to on side, doesn't make contact and the ball rolls off the pads
On the off stump line, full in length, tapped to the off side
on a length, outside off, nudged to point
on the off stump line, worked to midwicket for a single
on the off stump line, cut to gully
tip and run. Just tapped close on the off side, very close and they set off for a run. Pollock rushes across, tries to push it off his boot but the batsmen beat him
from wide of the crease, comes in on the off stump line, goes back and pushes it back down the track
on the pads, short of length, helped down to fine leg
quick single. Direct hit but Younis is in. Driven towards mid-off and they set off for a single. Smith fires in a throw at the striker's end but the batsman was well in.
on the off stump line, Younis gets right behind the line and defends with a full face of the bat
tip and run! On a length, honing in on the off stump, patted close on the off side and they get a comfortable single.
from wide of the crease, fullish, on middle stump line, Younis leans forward, flicks it to fine leg.
short of length, on the off stump line, Yousuf gets his wrists working overtime, sends it past square leg
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
lands on a length, on middle and off, driven to mid on
jumps up from a length, outside off, Younis was leaning forward, is surprised by the extra bounce, adjusts by arching back, dabs to gully
Walks across to the off stump, in fact outside off, whips a ball well outside off, to square leg for a single!

cheeky! Kicks up from short of length, outside off, Yousuf opens the bat-face and runs it through the vacant slip region. There are no slips in place, just a gully and Yousuf picked the gap skillfully.
on the hips, worked to on side for a single
leans forward, places a fullish ball towards mid-on and pick up an easy single.
50 partnership is up. driven to deep midwicket for a couple.
lands back of length, comes in from outside off, punched to cover
26th ODi fifty, 2nd against SA, Full and outside off, slashed away to wide thirdman
That ODI dab to thirdman and he will retain the strike. They are milking singles here.
banged in short, on the hips, tucked to fine leg
Super stop by Gibbs at point. Cut to left of him but he is like a wall there.
Almost holed up at long leg! Short and Younis swivelled off the front foot to pull it, in the air, behind square leg. Kemp moves to his right, and dives but can't reach to it.

Whack! Pollock again pitches it short but this time Younis went over midwicket. Super strike! On this track, if you have to pitch it short, it better be atleast throat high, else there will be violence from the batsman
fullish, on the off stump line, defended off the front foot
Kallis starts off with a length-delivery on middle and leg, worked to the on side
Kallis does the mistake of bowling short on this track. Above waist-high. Yousuf pulls it behind square leg. Easy.
fullish outside off stump, defended to the off side
outside off and run down to third man
pushed to cover region and they rush across for a quick single
starts off with a short delivery, on the off stump line, pulled away to deep midwicket
another long hop, pulled to long leg.
And again! Would you believe it, again just a single results. They are being too kind on Smith
better. fuller and on the off stump line, Yousuf goes back and works, with the turn, to the on side
turns in from outside off, turned to midwicket
fuller, on the off stump line, driven to long on
Whack! Another short pitched one which rises above waist-high and another pull shot. If you gonna pitch short, go for the throat gentlemen, else pitch it up
fuller, on the off and middle, driven to off side

almost carried back to Kallis and they pinch a single. Driven in the air, low to the right of Kallis who almost gets his palms under it and the ball bobs away behind the stumps at non-striker's end. Younis spots a single in it and calls over Yousuf for a single
again in the air briefly, but falls well short of Smith at midwicket
full and on the middle and leg, worked to square leg
driven back to the bowler
goes back and punches it to long on
short again, pulled to deep midwicket
beaten! fuller, outside off stump, Yousuf tries to run it to thirdman and misses.
on the middle, worked behind square leg, Yousuf wants a single, Ntini swoops on to it from backward squarleg and prevents the single
floated on the middle, defended off the front foot
slower one, on the legs, tucked to fine leg
on the stumps, turned to midwicket
Wah! Knifed through the line! Slower one and full in length, Younis picked it up early and lofted it over long off.
another slower one, driven to mid off
slips down leg side, runs off the pads to fine leg
floated outside off, Yousuf leans forward, drives to long on
turns in from outside off, nudged to cover
tossed up full and outside off, Younis goes sweeping but only ends up cleaning the air and is rapped on the front pad.
fullish, driven to long on
on middle and leg, worked past square leg
overpitched on the middle and leg, turned to square leg
And again, flicked past square leg
pushed to cover, he wants a run but denied by some quick fielding
beaten! In the zone outside off, Younis tries to tickle it fine and doesn't get a touch
full in length, on the middle and leg, worked behind square
driven to long on
low full toss, driven to long on
short this time and pulled away, in the air, out to deep midwicket
turns down leg side, Yousuf wants to sweep it fine, doesn't connect and surprisingly Bucknor doesn't signal it wide.
uses his feet and drives it to long off
slow through the air, outside off, Younis wants to late cut it but doesn't get the pace and just dabs it towards backward point
In the channel outside off, Yousuf leans towards the line, opens the bat-face, runs it to third man. 19 overs to go and Pakistan have wickets in hand.
slower, fullish, defended back down the track
right up there , on the middle stump line, driven to long on
slower one, outside off stump, Yousuf works it to on side
lands on a length, outside off stump, Yousuf tries to guide it fine through vacant slip region, doesn't pull it off well and the ball rolls to right of Boucher who makes the stop
Deja-vu! Almost guides it straight to Boucher. Just falls short and Boucher makes a diving stop.
Finally someone nails Smith. He has been bowling quite a few short stuff and got away with it but this time Younis pulls it over deep midwicket.
low full toss, driven to long on
on middle and leg, Yousuf goes back, turns it past square leg for a single
ooh!  Lands just outside off, on a length, turns in, Younis backs away to cut - neither the line nor the length for it, and almost inside-edges it on to his stumps
200 up with a drive to long on. 8 wickets still intact. Pakistan can go for the broke here.
Another single down to long on.
fullish, driven to cover
tight delivery. On the stumps and shaping in a touch, Yousuf shuffles across a bit and works it away towards square leg. No room for a single there

short of a good length delivery, close to the off stump line. Yousuf defends on the back-foot and the ball rolls away off the inside half of the bat. Younis Khan calls for the single and he sprints across before Boucher could get to it. Well run
slower delivery outside the off stump and Khan is bit early into the drive, one bounce and straight to Smith at short cover
short of a good length delivery, again in the channel and Khan is beaten outside the off stump
fuller length delivery, driven straight to the fielder at mid-on
tossed up and turning, worked away with the spin to the midwicket region

Khan departs! regular off-spinner, nothing special there - Khan comes down the track and tries to clear the fielder at long-off. Get the height but not the distance and Langeveldt in the deep nicely settles under it.
defended down on the leg side
worked away with the spin to the midwicke region
bit of width outside the off stump and Inzi cuts it away straight to the fielder at point
punched away off the back-foot to the deep cover and he is off the mark with an easy single

good length and cutting, Inzi shuffles across the line and gets the ball hits him on the pad, was looking to work it away on the leg side. Loud appeal for lbw turned down and rightly so - the ball hits him clearly outside the line of the off stump and height was also a problem
steered down to third man, a typical lazy looking effective shot from Inzi
good length delivery on the middle and leg stump line, defended towards midwicket
short of a good length delivery and Yousuf ends up with a bottom edge, ball rolls away behind the stumps and after few 'yes' and 'no' calls they decide not to go for it
good length delivery outside the off stump, sliced down to third man - again just a single
defended outside the off stump and the ball rolls away towards point. End of another excellent over from Polly
clipped away off the pads to the midwicket region
goes for the sweep but fails to make contact

there he goes! tossed up on the stumps, Inzi comes down the track to the pitch of the delivery, can't say he danced down - you mean what i know. It was a massive hoick and the ball sailed over the midwicket fence
pushed away towards point and Inzi calls for the single that was never there. Yousuf rightly says no, and as usual there is bit of confusion but in the end Inzi made it back safely
beaten outside the off stump and Boucher clips the bails, appeal turned down
tossed up on the stumps, defended on the back-foot and the ball rolls away back to the bowler
defended down behind the stumps on the off side
worked away off the back-foot, gets it through midwicket and they stroll across for a single
punched down to long-on for yet another easy single

good length and cutting in, Yousuf leans forward in an effort to work it away towards midwicket but fails to make contact. Loud appeal for lbw turned down. Was hit in line but the ball would have surely gone over the stumps
fifty! defended down on the leg side and they scamper through for a single, Pollock followed it up nicely but failed to cut off the single. Well played Yousuf
final ball of the spell and it's short and wide outside the off stump. Inzi just leans back and cuts it away to the vacant backward point fence
steered down to third man and they cross over for a single

well, well, well! believe it or not, Inzi has managed to run himself out, once again! defended on the front-foot and the ball rolls away towards point. Inzi just takes off a single that was never there. Yousuf rightly stood his ground and before Inzi could make it back, Gibbs swooped in from point, picked the ball up - ran towards the stumps and disturbed the furniture
played down to third man and Afrid is off the mark
way down the leg side
good length delivery, defended on the front-foot
forced away behind the stumps on the off side and they scamper through for a single
fullish, driven to cover

driven to mid-on, Yousuf wanted a run, Afridi , initially, didnt as the mid on fielder threw himself to his right, the ball beats him and Afridi runs across. Both the batsmen have a chat midpitch about the run! And only then Yousuf makes to his crease. hmm...
streaky edge to third man region. Full and outside off, Afridi drives and gets a edge
worked past square leg
full in length, on the middle stump line, worked straight to midwicket.
Another dot ball. Driven straight to mid off
fullish, on the middle and leg, heaved to long leg
Short of length, outside off stump, hit on the up to deep cover
Top-edged to fine leg! Banged in short and Afridi threw his bat at it and it flies off the top edge to fine leg boundary. Here we go!
The white ball is flying everywhere. This one disappears over deep midwicket. Short of length, and on the off stump line, Afridi flays it over the on side
Overpitched on the off stump line, driven to long off
slower on on the off stump line, Yousuf spots it, waits for it to arrive, nudges it to right of point and will get a single
Clean as a whistle! Fullish, on the middle stump line, Yousuf leans forward, picks it over midwicket. Deliberately played.
short of driveable length, outside off stump, comes in a touch, guided to short third man. Brings Afridi on strike.
attempted yorker, ends up a low full toss, driven to long on.
Short and Yousuf pulls it behind square leg, Kemp gets across from long leg to make the stop
Clean cricket stroke! No slogging from Yousuf. Just leans forward to a full-length delivery outside off and goes through the line and picks up a boundary to the long off region
Another boundary! Pakistan are on the rampage here. Kallis responds to the earlier shot by banging this one short, Yousuf swivels off his front foot and pulls it fine.
well-directed yorker. Right on the off and middle stump line, dug out, back to the bowler.

Wow! What a shot! Attempted yorker, ends up as a low full toss and somehow Afridi got under that ball and heaved it right over long off. The ball crashes into the camera lens of a photographer. That would be some shot!

Walks across the off stump, shovels a fullish delivery to midwicket. Smith fires in a direct hit at non-striker's end and they take a overthrow. It was referred upstairs, but Yousuf had just made his crease.
Nel continues to fire in the yorkers, this one on the off stump line, steered to third man
low full toss, whipped straight to deep midwicket. Nel was lucky there, could have disappeared over the ropes.

While Afridi bludgeons, Yousuf caresses and South Africa are bleeding by both methods. another low full toss, as another attempted yorker goes awry, just outside off stump, Younis opens the bat face and slices it through backward point.
yorker on the off stump line, jabbed away to the on side for a single
low full tosses galore here. This one is sent to deep cover. Brings back Afridi on strike. Where is this one going to go?
OMG! What a cheeky shot. Afridi just walks right across the stumps and sweeps, yes sweeps, a fullish ball to fine leg boundary!
from wide of the crease comes another low full toss, drilled to long on.

Sweetly timed. Super placement. Waist-high full toss, outside off stump, no panic, no desperate wave of the bat from Yousuf. He remains calm, opens the bat-face and steers it past point and beats the man at deep.
Streaky edge through vacant slip region. Full in length, outside off, Yousuf has a slash and it flies off the outer edge
lands on a length, outside off, comes in a touch, Yousuf taps it close on the off side
Slap! Slower one but short of length and Afridi plays a forehand down the line shot! Just swats it imperiously over long off
Boom Boom Afridi! This one flies over the bowler and beyond the ropes! Fullish, on the off and middle, and Afridi just knifes through the line.
Outside off and Afridi throws his bat at it and it runs down to third man. He will retain the strike. Five overs to go.

20-ball fifty! His 27th. What a cheeky way to get to it. Again he walks across, outside off and just sweeps a fullish delivery to right of short fine leg fielder. Took it on the full and swept it fine. And this is Ntini we are talking about, not some spinner. Mad max special! This is the second fastest fifty in South Africa. Ever.
sliced away! Fullish, outside off and he carves it, in the air, over backward point.
overpitched outside off, drilled to widish long off
Swing and a miss.In the channel outside off, Yousuf has a slash but doesn't connect.
length-delivery, outside off stump, dabbed to thirdman
yorker on the middle and leg, dug out to the on side
Very cute. Very inventive. Very effective. He just walks across, reaches out for a fullish delivery outside off, takes it on the full and whips it across to deep midwicket
Fullish, outside off stump, Afridi can't get a touch to it and a rare dot ball results
shovelled away to the on side and he rushes across for a quick single

Afridi is almost run out.Low full toss, driven to cover, Smith picks up, fires in a throw, and Afridi just about manages to make his ground. Criminal mistake from Afridi. He doesn't slide it in, just gets his bat over the line and places it and hence all this trouble. It is refered upstairs, not out is the verdict.
This one flies over short fine.  Fullish on the leg and middle, Yousuf walks across like Afridi, plays a pick-up shot over that fielder. Very skilful.
rotates the strike to Afridi with a dab to thirdman
Slap slog! Low full toss, outside off stump, Afridi slices it., carves it, flat bats it over long off. He is all smiles, walks across to have a chat with Yousuf.
Fullish, drilled to long off.
walks across the stumps, nudges a fullish delivery on the middle stump line to square leg. What will Afridi do now? sweep, slog or pull?
He goes for the slog. A near-yorker is swiped away to deep midwicket. It made contact with the toe-end of the bat and hence he couldn't get much power behind that.
Fullish, well outside off, Afridi shapes for a drive but seeing the width lets it go through. Wide called. Boucher and Nel not happy with the call.
pretty similar to the previous delivery, this time Afridi has a fling, misses and Bucknor doesn't call this one a wide

Clubbed! Crashes into the roof over deep midwicket! Full-toss, as another yorker goes awry and Afridi smokes it across the line. The ball bounds off the roof and lands in the car park. New balls are coming out! What a batsman! This batting line up, if they can get it right, would be something to watch in the World Cup.
shovelled to midwicket and he takes the single. Yousuf is on 95.

Fullish, outside off stump, Yousuf goes on a bent knee to drive, misses. Looks at the umpire for a possible wide call. Doesn't, and rightfully at that, get it. Nel shakes his head at Yousuf, suggesting that was no wide mate. Immense fun!
bangs this one short, a bumper. well directed one and Boucher gathers.

Yousuf moves to 99. Slices away a fullish delivery through backward point. Precision placement. While Afridi has biffed and clubbed his way, this man has just caressed his way. Contrasting styles but both are getting the runs.
almost a yorker, drilled to long off. Brings Yousuf on strike. Just one short of the magic mark.
beaten! Outside off, Yousuf tries to play it late, through the vacant slip region and doesn't connect. A valuable dot ball for SA.

12th hundred, his first one against SA. Fullish, outside off, driven to long off and he celebrates it in his fashion. Goes down to the ground, touches the turf with his head. His second fifty came in just 35 balls.
Yorker outside off stump, Afridi walks right across his stumps, tries to whip it across the line but doesn't connect. This has been a very good over from Langeveltd.
Just a single. Langeveldt continues to keep it tight. Fullish, outside off, driven to long off

Very good over from Charles. Yorker, Yousuf tries to swing it across, doesn't make proper contact and they will just get a single.   So, Pakistan have ended up with a massive 351. Can South Africa, who had such a great time with the bat in the first game, chase this under the lights? Join us in a while.

inn2.comm: Asif starts off hitting the right line and length. On a length, outside off and it angles away, left alone.
almost cut him in half! This one lands outside off stump, on a length and holds its line, Smith's bat comes down in a an angle, outside the line and is beaten
fuller, on the off stump line, Smith gets behind that one and defends
Smith is up and away. Overpitched outside off, Smith leans forward and drives between mid-on and the bowler.
Appreciable movement there! A feedbacker had told us earlier that this pitch gets animated under lights and here was the proof. Swing in the air and then movement off the track. Left alone.
fuller, on middle and leg, worked to the on side
lands on a length, on the middle stump line, goes on straight, turned to square leg.
probing delivery on the middle stump line, hint of movement back in, de Villiers gets behind the line, turns it to on side.
weak pull! Not that short and on the middle stump line, de Villiers goes for a pull and just bobs it to the on side.
slightly short of length, on the middle, shovelled away, in the air, through midwicket. Not well timed and hence doesn't get any power behind it .
de Villiers brings up his first boundary of the chase. Short of length, just outside off and he forces it off the back foot, past point. Cleanly struck.
dropped by Afridi at midwicket. Back of length, on the middle, pulled away, again weakly, to left of Afridi who dives but couldn't hold on to it.
in the zone outside off, left alone.
the ball is skidding off the track here. Under the lights. This one whistles past the off stump, left alone by the batsman
this one cuts back in sharply. Lovely line and length, outside off stump, and nips back in as de Villiers shoulders arms
fuller, straighter, just outside off, driven to cover region
crack! Short of length, outside off stump, holds its line, de Villiers rocks back, cuts but straight to wide third man
just outside off, on a length, skids on off the truf, de Villiers shapes to force it away off the back foot but is hurried by the delivery, just pushes it out to the off side in the end
success this time. bit more width and he cuts past point and it beats Razzaq manning the widish thirdman region

scooped over midwicket! Slightly short of length, on the middle stump line and he pulls it, in the air, over midwicket. Afridi gives the chase and pulls a sliding effort but can't reach the ball. Rana is disappointed.
immediately adjusts his length. Hurls this one fuller, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
top-edged over slips! The runs are coming here. In a rush. slightly short of length, angled across Smith who goes for a pull and ends up slashing it over the slips.
lands on a length, around off stump, Smith stays backs, opens the bat-face, runs it down to thirdman
lovely probing delivery! On a length, on the middle stump line, and shapes away, Smith is opened up as he tries to work it to on side, gets a edge and it flies past slip

huge appeal for lbw! Lands outside off stump, on a length, comes back in and clips the pad as de Villiers shoulders arms. It didn't come back enough to hit the wicket. Asif keeps running on and ends up near the batsman. only then he turns to appeal.
length-delivery, honing in on the off stump, de Villiers leans forward and this time offers the wood to the leather
another nip-backer has him in trouble. Jags back in from a length outside off stump, de Villiers gets an inside edge as he pushes at it.
Whack! after few probing deliveries Asif serves this short and wide and de Villiers jumps on the lapse. Spanks it over point.
fuller, straighter, outside off stump, left alone.
length-delivery, angling across Smith who goes back to punch it to off side
hits the deck on a length, just outside off stump, no room for Smith to cut, so he just dabs it to point
lands on a length, on the middle and off, moves back in slightly, de Villiers brings his bat down in time, makes contact and pushes the ball to the on side.
similar strangling line and length on the middle stump line, again defended away.
And again. Punched back to the bowler, who stretches his right hand out but doesn't quite stop the ball and they rush across for the single by the time the mid-on moves to his left to make the stop
Thrash! Rana now shortens the length and Smith makes him pay. Pulls it over midwicket.
fullish, on the off and middle, squirted out to widish midwicket

Asif takes out Smith! Lands on a length, on middle stump line, moves away, Smith is again opened up as he tries to turn it across the line and edges it to second slip, right into the palms of Younis. Pakistan strike first blow. The captain is out. Enter Jacques Kallis.
Confident start by Kallis. Leans forward to a length-delivery on off and middle, drives to left of mid-on where Yousuf gets across to make the stop
on the off stump line, kicks up from a length, Kallis jabs at it and gets a inside edge to the on side
again another inside edge this time to square leg. Similar delivery.
Asif pitches it further up, outside off and makes it hold its line, Kallis leans forward, stabs at it and gets a outer edge, down to thirdman. Probing over from Asif comes to an end.
full, outside off, sliced away to point.
steered through the vacant second slip area. On a length, outside off and Kallis guides it past the lone slipper and will get a boundary. Now the second slip has moved in. Horse and stable door eh.
on the hips, tucked past square leg. Afridi gives the chase and they run hard to get three
Bosh! Short delivery, and de Villiers pulls it over midwicket. We saw during Pakistan's batting that whenver the bowlers pitched it short, it disappeared. Nothing has changed now.
biffed! Fuller and outside off stump, de Villiers square-drives it past point. The length was fine but width was offered and Villiers cashed in.
on the middle and off, from a length, punched to mid-on and they run with the stroke
just short of driveable length, outside off stump, de Villers leans forward and blocks it back to the bowler
Similar line and length, this time pushed out to cover region.
slap! Asif catches the short-pitched disease, hurls it outside off and de Villiers just swats it past the bowler, past the umpire Bucknor and to the ropes
lands on a length, on off stump line, punched to cover
singing through the channel outside off, de Villiers respects the tune and shoulders arms

Imran Nazir makes a super stop. At point. Slightly short and de Villier cuts it fiercely to Imran who dives to his right to make the stop. Gets up quickly and fires in a throw at non-striker's end, misses but is backed up.

huge huge shout for lbw! The height was the problem. Lands on a length, on the off stump line and it holds its line. Kallis reaches out for it tentatively and plays for the one that comes back in and the ball evades the bat and brushes the back thigh. It was going over the off stump and umpire Jerling calls it right
Kallis backs away to the leg side and tries to slog this out of Durban, doesn't connect and Akmal comes into play
Razzaq raps Kallis on the pads. Again. This one comes back in and Kallis thought it would go on straight, bat comes down outside the line and he is rapped on the back thigh
drifts in on middle and leg, flicked away but straight to Afridi at midwicket
Razzaq ends a what was good over with a poor delivery, down the leg side, tickled away fine.

Asif appeals like Dennis Lillee. Screaming shout. Lands on a length, on off and middle, nips back in to rap him high on the pads. The height must have been the problem. Asif is not happy, he is waiting for the big screen to see the replay. No luck there. Mutters and gets back to top of his mark. Hawk eye agrees with Bucknor.
driven to cover
In the channel outside off stump, Kallis tries to force it off the back foot, doesn't get a touch and is beaten. The crowd are really getting into the game. Lots of noise and buzz around the arena
steals a single with a drive to extra cover
outside off stump, left alone
overpitched on leg and middle, Kallis stands up tall, drives it elegantly through midwicket.
on a length, again drifting on to the pads, de Villiers tries to pull it away, misses and it runs off the pads to short fine leg
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
Wow! Fantastic shot over cover! Almost a six. Short of length and outside off, Kallis rocked back and knifed through the line, over cover.
Kallis is moving around the crease. First he backs away, then walks right across, Razzaq stays calm, hurls it on the middle stump line, and he is tucked to fine leg
Almost carried to Asif at deep backward square leg. slightly short, on the hips, pulled in the air, one bounce to Asif.
slightly short of length, on the off stump line, swatted away to right of Yousuf at mid on
Inzy dives! Great stop. Lands on a length, on the off stump line, Kallis punches it through the line to cover where Inzamam dives to his left to make the stop
Banged in short, good surprise bouncer, rises head-high, Kallis shapes to pull and is beaten by the bounce. Asif appeals.Alone.
Slower one! full and outside off, Kallis went through with his stroke and clears cover.
Good response! Kicks up from a length. Outside off stump and it held its line. Kallis stabs at it and is beaten.
around off, nudged to point
length delivery, just outside off, cut to Imran Nazir at point
crack! Short and wide, smoked past point.
again bit of width outside off, but the length is fuller and cut straight to point
Razzaq prises out de Villiers. 87 for 2. Slightly short of length, and it hastens off the track, de Villiers goes for the pull and ends up shovelling a dolly to Younis at midwicket.
defended away on the front foot
good length delivery outside the off stump and Kaliis tamely defends it down on the off side
there are certainly looking to play his out. Another tight delivery on the middle and off stump line, drifting in - Kallis stays back and plays it away towards short midwicket
in the channel outside the off stump, Jallis defends on the back-foot and the ball rolls away off the outside edge
defended on the front-foot
short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, Gibbs stays back and taps it away towards cover
good length delivery outside the off stump, Gibbs drives off the back-foot and the ball goes straight to the fielder at point. Nicely timed shot but the placement was poor
good length delivery, defended on the back-foot
worked away towards square leg
take that! slightly short and close to the off stump line, Gibbs stands tall on the back-foot and punches it away through cover point
this is good cricket from Gibbs. After the boundary he plays one wide of mid-on and they scamper through for a single

good length delivery outside the off stump, Kallis goes back and drives it past the fielder at gully. Nicely opened the face of the bat at the point of impact to get the placement right, ran the first run quickly and comfortably made it across for the second
again steered away off the back-foot to the third man region, easy single to end the over
good length delivery on the middle and off stump line, Kallis stays back and plays it back to the bowler
driven well wide of the fielder at mid-on
short of a good length delivery, bit of width offered outside the off stump and Gibbs punches it down to third man
beaten! good length delivery and this one shapes away a touch. Kallis is sucked forward into the defensive prod and the ball zips past the outside edge. you beauty
angled down to third man and the South African 100 comes up
defended on the front-foot and the ball rolls away towards point.
good length delivery outside the off stump, driven straight to the fielder at point
good length delivery outside the off stump and Kallis works it down to third down
good length delivery outside the off stump, Gibbs stays back and drops it behind the stumps on the off side, early call and a quick single is added to the total
drifting on to middle and leg, Kallis fails to make contact but the ball rolls away off the pad and Gibbs sprints across for a well judged single
MAX! good length delivery on the stumps, Gibbs advances down the track and lofts it over the wide long-on fence, that's the first six of the South African innings - we are on...
driven wide of the cover fielder, easy single to end the over
good length delivery, tight delivery and Gibbs drives it back to the bowler
similar line and length, Gibbs goes at it hard but fails to time it properly and the ball finds the bowler, came off the bottom edge

All in due time but first he gets rid of Gibbs. All the same an Asif special, pitched close to the off stump line and nipping back in. Gibbs looks to play across the line and is beaten, ball thuds into the pad and they go up for an lbw. All that happened in real time and then it was Bucknor in slow motion. Up goes the finger and that's a priceless wicket
thick outside edge and the ball rolls away towards short third man
played away on the leg side and Prince takes off for a single, big mix-up but the shy at the bowler's end fails to hit the target and Prince lives on
defended outside the off stump and that's the end of a fantastic spell - time to hit the shower
good length delivery outside the off stump, defended watchfully
good length delivery on the middle and leg stump line, worked away off the pads to the square leg region
good length delivery outside the off stump, defended on the front-foot and the ball rolls away towards cover

another big fish netted! short of a good length delivery outside the off stump, Kallis drives off the back-foot, not the perfect looking shot that we are so used to seeing. There was a sound as the ball passed the outside edge. Loud appeal and up goes the dreaded finger. South Africa four down and in deep trouble here.
yorker first up and Boucher digs it out
wide down the leg side
Short and wide, cut past point.  The break will upset the rhythm of the players.
top-edged over slips! Banged in short and Boucher goes for the pull and it flies over the first slip.

Redemption song for Mahmood. It took two years for him to come back into the team. He played for the county, for the domestic team and generally wallowed outside the team. But what a dramatic comeback, helped by Prince. Strikes gold with his first ball. Slightly wide outside the off stump, Prince slashes and edges it hard to right of Younis, the lone slipper, who lunges across to take a smart catch.
comes back in and raps him on the pads
well outside off, left alone
some swing there! Full, sucking Kemp forward into a drive before it left him.
slips down leg side and tickled to fine leg
fullish, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
this time he finds the gap in the on side and works it past midwicket
Abdul Razzaq has been all over the shop ever since resumption. Full, on the legs, even I would have got atleast two, Boucher flicks it for a boundary.
better, on the off stump line, nudged to point
gift-wraps another boundary. Boucher rips opens the packet with glee. Short and it sat up to be hit and Boucher obliged.
slightly short of length, outside off stump line, punched to cover
Whistling through the channel outside off stump, left alone and the ball shaves past the off stump.
lands on a length, on off, comes back in, nudged to square leg
punchy drive. overpitched on middle stump line, driven down the ground and Yousuf intervenes with a full-length dive from mid-on. Just a single.
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the off stump line
outside off, on a length, forced away off the backfoot to Afridi at deep point.
slightly short of length, outside off, Boucher backs away to cut but straight to cover
fires in that one quicker, straighter, on the middle stump line, Boucher gets his bat down in a hurry, makes contact and sends it behind square leg
some turn! Lands on the off stump line, breaks away, Kemp dabs it to off side
And again. But this one is shorter, allows Kemp to cut past cover. The ball spun more than he expected and hence his cut shot went past cover instead of point
slightly slower, outside off stump, turns away, pushed to cover
shout for lbw but there was an inside edge. Full-pitched, on the off stump line, comes back in a touch, Kemp drives but gets a edge on to his pads
on the middle and leg, again full in length, pushed to mid-on
a single down to fine leg. South Africa face a real uphill task here.
goes for the surprise bouncer. Boucher shapes to pull but pulls out at the end as the ball climbs head-high
fuller, nips back in from just outside off - Mahmood is bowling a very impressive line and length here- defended to cover
back of length, on middle stump line, moves in a touch, Boucher tucks it past square leg for couple of runs
floated up on the middle, driven back to the bowler
drags this one short and Kemp rocks back to cut it to sweeper cover
slightly slower through the air, outside off, full in length, swatted across the line and under edge gets the ball behind square leg
on the off and middle, slight turn, punched to long off

The forgotten men come to the party. First Mahmood and now Afridi.Cleans up Boucher with a top spinner. Lands on the off stump line, slightly short of length,  and goes straight on, Boucher shapes to pull, bat comes down outside the line - he anticipated some turn, and the off stump is pegged back.
on the middle stump line, tucked to long leg
full-pitched on the middle stump line, pushed out to mid on
lands on a length, just outside off, comes in a touch, Kemp eases forward, head over the ball ,defends. 149 for 6.
perfect line and length.  just outside off and full in length. Kemp pays respect.
strays on to the pads and Kemp dismisses him this time. Picks it over midwicket, ala Hooper.
corrects the length, hits the good length area, on the middle, nudged to the on side
quickish topspinner on the off stump line, cut away for a single
slower and fuller, almost traps him lbw as Pollock thrusts his left foot across. But he adjusts to work it past square leg
on the middle and leg, defended to on side
on the off stump this time, pushed away to sweeper cover
slower and bit more air, on middle and leg, Pollock leans forward, has to wait for the ball to arrive and he defends
on a length, around middle and off, worked to right of mid on
creamed through the off side. Overpitched outside off and Pollock drives it to the left of mid-off.
Whipped away! Fullish, on the middle stump line, Pollock leans forward and whiplashes it over midwicket. Nice pick-up shot.
Bouncer! But bit too high over Pollock's head and a wide is called.
hits the back of length, around off stump line, dabbed away to point
on the hips, tucked away to fine leg and will retain the strike.
fastish, on the off stump, tapped to point.
slightly short, outside off, cut past point
really quick slider. On the off stump line, Kemp shapes to cut and adjusts to bring his bat down in a real hurry as the ball hastens on towards the off stump. pushes it out to off side
fuller, slower, driven to long on
on the middle and leg, worked to on side. Afridi is really mixing things up. Fast, slow,  leg spin, top spin, slider.
tossed up on the off stump line, driven to long on
floated on the off stump line, pushed to off side

Massive! Disappears out of the ground! Tossed up on the off stump line and Pollock swings it over deep midwicket. Super strike! Camera pans to Malik and he is seen scratching his head. Meanwhile the box with replacement balls have arrived.
fires in a quicker one but ends up slipping it down leg side
short of length and again cranks up the pace, tucked behind square leg
flatter and Kemp charges out but is beaten in the flight and by the turn and is rapped on the pad
Gone! Malik strikes. Kemp is back in the hutch. On the off stump line, driven right back to Malik who takes it. South Africa are tottering here under lights.
slow through the air, outside off stump, dabbed away
sharp turn there! quickish delivery on middle and off stump sucks Pollock forward before it spins past him.
slightly slower and driven through the off side
outside off, squirted out to short thirdman
on the pads, worked behind square leg
turns in from just outside off, turned past square leg. Played with the spin.
again bit of turn, breaks from middle and off towards leg, worked past square leg
Almost cleans up Nel. Wild swing to a tossed up delivery outside off but this one doesn't turn, goes on straight, just shaving past off stump
shout for lbw but it was probably going down leg. Lands just outside off, turns in, Nel tries to pull it to leg side but doesn't get a touch.
slider on the off stump line, hastens off the turf and stays slightly low, Pollock shapes to pull and is beaten by the pace and the height, manages to swat it to on side
slower this time and bit of turn and Pollock gets a leading edge as he pushes at it. The ball rolls past cover.
beaten. Full and outside off, Nel ends up playing down the wrong line
quick, on the middle, trying to trap him in front, turned past square leg
leans forward to defend a full-length delivery to cover
Nel goes for a wild swing across the line, gets a inner edge and the ball rolls away to fine leg
full and straight, driven to long on
well outside off, slightly short, dabbed to short third man. Nel wants a run, Polliock sends him back and he makes it back in time.
on the off and middle, heaved to deep square leg
comes down the track, Malik drags back the length and Pollock tries to work it on side and is rapped on the pad
on the off stump line, swung over to deep midwicket

Afridi nails another victim. Slow through the air and it landed just outside leg stump before turning right across. Nel watched it turn, suddenly decided that it should be whipped across the line and ended up getting a inner edge.
Ntini nearly falls first ball. Outside off and he goes inside the line and the ball just teases the outside edge
Again. This time he tries to cut but can't connect.
beaten again.  full in length, on middle, Ntini goes for a drive but Afridi has the keys, and turns the ball sharply, taking the outside edge and it rolls away to point
deja-vu at Durban. Afridi beats Ntini. Again and again. This one just kisses past the outside edge.
flatter on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Pulled away. Slightly short and on the off stump line, Pollock rocks back to swing it over midwicket
fires in a massive wide down the leg side. He wanted to bowl that one real fast and ended up pushing it too wide
on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot
Back to regular programming. lands on the leg stump line, turns in Ntini tries to work it on side and is rapped on the pad
beaten again! Ntini's misery continues. beaten by a legbreak outside off stump
Ah! he breaks free with a lofted drive to widish long off. Tossed up by Afridi well outside off and he flat batted it to left of long off
turns away from off stump, Ntini pushes at it with an open-face of the bat and it spees past slip
sharp turn. lands outside off stump, break back in, Ntini doesn't offer a stroke and the ball brushes his pad enroute rolling away to fine leg
wide down leg side
on the off stump line, turns in to rap him on the pad as he pushes forward in defense
slightly short, turns in from outside off, punched to long off
beaten. Outside off stump and Ntini plays down the wrong line. Akmal gathers and underarm flicks it to Younis at first slip who is not looking and the ball lands on his head!
Afridi puts Ntini out of misery. Tossed up outside off and Ntini couldn't resist a swing and warms the palms of long off
short and pulled to square leg
tossed up on the off and middle, defended off the front foot

That's it ...  Pakistan wrap up  comprehensive series-levelling win. Great comeback win from them. Victory by 141 runs. Akmal, who has been under the kosh, brings up the victory with a smart stumping. Malik slips it down the leg side, Pollock overbalances himself while trying to flick it and is dragged out of the crease. He can only get back his feet on the line before Akmal knocks the bails off.
